rename.from: Zap Report Counting Bug Not Applied in 2.5
rename.to: Alerts with different method are considered the same

body: Per discussion in dev thread changing the issue to include the request method when differentiating the alerts.

rename.from: Alerts with different method are considered the same
rename.to: Alerts with different request method are considered the same

issue.title: Use request method to differentiate alerts

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change Alert class to use the request method to differentiate the alerts
(in equals/hashCode/compareTo) and to include the request method when
converting to XML (which is included in the XML report).
Change CoreAPI to include the request method in the details of the
alerts.
Change HTML XSL (used for HTML report) to include the request method for
each alert.

Fix #2757 - Alerts with different request method are considered the same

issue.title: Initialise Alert's method to an empty string

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
The change prevents NullPointerException when testing for equality,
doing comparisons or obtaining the hash code if the alert no longer has
a message (thus the method was not being set to a non-null value).

---

Issue reported in IRC. Related to #2757.

issue.title: Jenkins ZAProxy plugin issue on HTML and XML report generation

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Hi,

When I open ZAP session (.session) file that is generated after scanning a website using ZAProxy plugin on Jenkins, the number of issues (high, medium, low and info) are not same as shown in HTML and XML report generated by the plugin tool.

FYI - I am running this on Windows 7 (Jenkins + ZAP) and using custom plugin to launch ZAP and ZAProxy plugin to scan the website.

Thanks to fix this reporting issue at the earliest possible on Jenkins ZAProxy plugin.

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
